definition: to follow/to adhere to/to abide by
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: In a matrix, or "round robin" competition, a round allows all contestants in a pool to fight once.
sentences.chinese: 在循环赛中，每一轮允许所有选手均比赛一次。

sentences.english: and they talk to each sorority like, they make a little round-robin kind of thing.
sentences.chinese: 跟每个联谊会谈话，有一点循环赛的感觉。

sentences.english: The tournament will be a round robinfor all the high school teams in the city.
sentences.chinese: 本届全市中学队锦标赛将进行循环赛。

sentences.english: The first part: All teams are divided into 2 groups using the single round robin rule. The rank is depended on accumulated points.
sentences.chinese: 第一阶段分二个小组打单循环赛，按积分算名次。

sentences.english: One circle system of ball games could possibly make one team into the most unfavorable situation.
sentences.chinese: 单循环赛制有可能使其中某队陷于严重不公平的境地。

sentences.english: You want to win this series of round robin tournaments against the Full Tilt Professional line up?
sentences.chinese: 你想赢得这个系列赛的循环赛对全速专业行吗？

sentences.english: It went back to a knock out format with no round-robin.
sentences.chinese: 放弃循环赛重新采用了淘汰制。

sentences.english: The player defaulted in the tournament because of her injury.
sentences.chinese: 在这次循环赛中，这位运动员由于受伤而弃权。

sentences.english: for all the high school teams in the city.
sentences.chinese: 本届全市中学队锦标赛将进行循环赛。

definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
(sports) semifinal or quarterfinal/to compete in a semifinal (or a quarterfinal)
to compete/to take part in a competition
